answers.answer: I responded in the other thread, but want to respond here as well. Those are high readings and she should be seen by her doctor soon. If she becomes ill and vomits, she should go to the ER, but it sounds like the doctor can see her and do an A1C test. If she is diagnosed with type 1 diabetes, let us know and I will send you a PM to a website with a lot more information and other parents. You are not alone, it can be overwhelming to get this diagnosis, but it is a condition that can be managed and she can live a long and happy life.

question: my daughter age 6 asked a diabetic friend to ***** her finger (she always does strange things like that lol) and the reading came back @ 262. it was after eating alot of snacks and juice boxes at the lake. So the next morning before she ate i asked my friend to ***** her finger again and it was 220 should i be concerned, what should I do?
title: shellshocked
